content:
• Tuesday, August 2, 2011
  • VMC

    More on Vulcan Materials (NYSE:VMC): Q2 results show bottom-line outperformance, despite a rise...

    More on Vulcan Materials (NYSE:VMC): Q2 results show bottom-line outperformance, despite a rise in diesel fuel costs, but a miss on top line sales. Profits took a hit from weak demand for aggregates, as April's severe weather and flooding throughout the company's river-centric markets put many projects on hold. Shares -3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:03 PM | 1 Comment
  • NPSP

    NPS Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:NPSP) terminates and replaces a prior collaborative research...

    NPS Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:NPSP) terminates and replaces a prior collaborative research agreement with GlaxoSmithKline (NYSE:GSK) dating back to 1993. The new agreement will assign two new compounds for study and expand the company's field of research on other drugs. NPSP +7.9%, [[GSK] -0.9% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:05 PM
  • JCOM

    Internet software and services provider j2 Global (NASDAQ:JCOM) reports Q2 revenue of $85.7M...

    Internet software and services provider j2 Global (NASDAQ:JCOM) reports Q2 revenue of $85.7M (+40% Y/Y), and EPS of $0.65, easily beating expectations of $0.58. The company also increases its FY11 outlook and declares its first-ever dividend of $0.20 per share. Shares +11.6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:47 PM
  • SIMG

    Silicon Image (NASDAQ:SIMG): Q2 non-GAAP EPS of $0.05 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $53.6M (+20%...

    Silicon Image (NASDAQ:SIMG): Q2 non-GAAP EPS of $0.05 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $53.6M (+20% Y/Y) beats by $1.3M. Guides for Q3 revenue of $60M-$62M, in-line with consensus of $61.9M. Growth driven by chips supporting MHL interface for transmitting HD video from mobile devices, and by IP licensing business. SIMG +4.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:30 PM
  • OPEN

    OpenTable (NASDAQ:OPEN): Q2 EPS of $0.33 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $34.3M (+53% Y/Y) misses by...

    OpenTable (NASDAQ:OPEN): Q2 EPS of $0.33 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $34.3M (+53% Y/Y) misses by $1M. Installed restaurant base up 60% Y/Y; seated diners up 53%. Shares -8.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:41 PM
  • HTZ

    Hertz (NYSE:HTZ): Q2 EPS of $0.26 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $2.07B beats by $0.04B. Shares...

    Hertz (NYSE:HTZ): Q2 EPS of $0.26 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $2.07B beats by $0.04B. Shares +4.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:38 PM
  • SFSF

    SuccessFactors (NYSE:SFSF): Q2 EPS of $0.03 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $73M (+48% Y/Y)...

    SuccessFactors (NYSE:SFSF): Q2 EPS of $0.03 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $73M (+48% Y/Y) beats by $3M. Expects Q3 revenue of $83M-84M vs. $72M, and full-year revenue of $310M-315M vs. $284M. Shares +9.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM
  • TMX

    Shares of Telmex (NYSE:TMX) finish the day +9.1% after America Movil (NYSE:AMX) says it's...

    Shares of Telmex (NYSE:TMX) finish the day +9.1% after America Movil (NYSE:AMX) says it's looking to buy the remaining 40% of the company it doesn't already own.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM
  • FEED

    Shares of AgFeed Industries (OTC:FEED -33%) were hammered today, after guiding Q2 results lower...

    Shares of AgFeed Industries (OTC:FEED -33%) were hammered today, after guiding Q2 results lower due to bad investments in China. It now expects to report revenues of approximately $84M, far below previous estimates of $92M. The company has also cancelled the spin-off of its animal nutrition business due to weak market conditions.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM
  • ASRT

    Drug developer Depomed (DEPO) falls 14.6% after reporting Q2 revenue of $21.2M (-13% Y/Y) and...

    Drug developer Depomed (DEPO) falls 14.6% after reporting Q2 revenue of $21.2M (-13% Y/Y) and EPS of -$0.11, missing a consensus of $22.1M and -$0.05. SG&A expenses rose 67% Y/Y, as the company ramped sales and marketing spending related to the Q4 release of its Gralise drug for treating neuralgia. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:55 PM | 1 Comment
  • BPI

    Bridgepoint Education (BPI -13%) handily beats Q2 estimates, but concerns over new enrollments...

    Bridgepoint Education (BPI -13%) handily beats Q2 estimates, but concerns over new enrollments have investors selling the stock today. New student enrollment rose just 3.3% in the latest quarter, far below the double-dt pace in past years.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:54 PM

  • Gold's gains are accelerating as stocks move the other way. The yellow metal is hitting new...

    Gold's gains are accelerating as stocks move the other way. The yellow metal is hitting new records seemingly with each tick, now +2.1% at $1656/oz.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • LOJN

    Lo-Jack (LOJN -8.6%) takes a hit today after posting a better Q2 EPS but missing on net sales....

    Lo-Jack (LOJN -8.6%) takes a hit today after posting a better Q2 EPS but missing on net sales. Top-line revenues were negatively impacted by a shift in its brand and model mix, plus a slowdown in bulk installations due to a shortage of dealer vehicle inventory.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:41 PM
  • CEB

    Consulting firm Corporate Executive Board Co. (EXBD) falls 15.9% after reporting Q2 revenue of...

    Consulting firm Corporate Executive Board Co. (EXBD) falls 15.9% after reporting Q2 revenue of $119.2M (+9% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.30, below a consensus of $120.5M and $0.37. The company is reiterating its 2011 revenue forecast of $480M-$500M and non-GAAP EPS of forecast of $1.50-$1.65, in-line with a consensus of $439.1M and $1.63. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:41 PM
  • CCC-OLD

    Calgon Carbon (CCC-OLD +6.8%), maker of water and air purifiers, posts Q2 results that fall...

    Calgon Carbon (CCC-OLD +6.8%), maker of water and air purifiers, posts Q2 results that fall slightly below expectations, but Janney says the real story is the growth opportunity, not the "uninspiring" quarter. Calgon also says its mercury removal opportunity may prove larger than originally expected, and that its ballast water business is accelerating nicely.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:34 PM
  • TZOO

    Travel deals site Travelzoo (NASDAQ:TZOO) is up 1% on a rough day for tech stocks as the company...

    Travel deals site Travelzoo (NASDAQ:TZOO) is up 1% on a rough day for tech stocks as the company announces it's surpassed 24M subscribers, with 1M subscribers added in the last 3 months. Travelzoo shares were clocked in July following an earnings miss.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:30 PM
  • ARIA

    More on ARIAD Pharmaceuticals (ARIA -9.4%): shares take a hit today after its Q2 misses...

    More on ARIAD Pharmaceuticals (ARIA -9.4%): shares take a hit today after its Q2 misses estimates. Restructuring charges related to its agreement with Merck (MRK -1.7%), as well as a revaluation of the company's warrant liability both dug a deeper-than-anticipated hole into bottom-line margins.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:24 PM
  • IPG

    Shares of Interpublic Group (IPG -4.6%) fall on volume 2X normal, getting very little help from...

    Shares of Interpublic Group (IPG -4.6%) fall on volume 2X normal, getting very little help from an upgrade issued earlier by Morgan Stanley. The firm raised its rating on the global marketing company to Overweight from Equal Weight with a new price target of $12, citing a low valuation and an improved balance sheet.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:03 PM
  • XSPA

    Shares of microcap Vringo (VRNG) soar +28% after the mobile phone ringtone developer launches...

    Shares of microcap Vringo (VRNG) soar +28% after the mobile phone ringtone developer launches its Facetones product in the Japanese market with assistance from NTT DoCoMo (DCM -0.3%).

     
     
     
     
    | 2:54 PM
  • T

    Leap Wireless (LEAP -18.3%) is falling in sympathy with rival MetroPCS (PCS -32.8%), as the...

    Leap Wireless (LEAP -18.3%) is falling in sympathy with rival MetroPCS (PCS -32.8%), as the latter's weak results bring into question the long-term success of discount wireless carriers. Leap, which has over $2.4B in net debt compared with $832M in equity, has seen negative free cash flow each of the last 3 years.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:53 PM
  • TPR

    More on Coach (COH -5.8%): shares are weak today, despite topping FQ4 estimates with a solid 4%...

    More on Coach (COH -5.8%): shares are weak today, despite topping FQ4 estimates with a solid 4% increase in net income. Investors are expressing disappointment with the narrow distribution of sales, as net gains came primarily from high-end merchandise to wealthy customers unaffected by the economic slowdown.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:47 PM

  • Shares of L&L Energy (LLE +11.3%) confound and move higher, even as Glaucus Research raises...

    Shares of L&L Energy (LLE +11.3%) confound and move higher, even as Glaucus Research raises fraud issues with the Chinese company's ownership of a subsidiary. Not pulling any punches, the research firm calls the issue "at best a major violation of SEC disclosure rules and at worst textbook fraud."
     
     
     
     
    | 2:35 PM | 1 Comment
  • TECH

    Shares of Techne (TECH +5.4%) soar after the firm books a 7.8% increase in Q4 sales, helped by...

    Shares of Techne (TECH +5.4%) soar after the firm books a 7.8% increase in Q4 sales, helped by acquisitions and foreign exchange gains. The firm missed by a penny on EPS, reporting $0.76/share vs consensus $0.77/share.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:17 PM
  • SPGI

    McGraw-Hill’s (MHP +8.9%) breakup value, in the event it decides to accelerate its plan to...

    McGraw-Hill’s (MHP +8.9%) breakup value, in the event it decides to accelerate its plan to spin off businesses, likely would be ~$55/share but potentially as high as $70, Lazard analysts say. Speculation is swirling after the disclosure that Jana Partners - with a history of pressuring companies to make changes - teamed with a Canadian pension fund to own a 5.2% stake.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:59 PM
  • MTOR

    Commercial vehicle parts manufacturer Meritor (NYSE:MTOR) drops 12.5% after reporting FQ3...

    Commercial vehicle parts manufacturer Meritor (NYSE:MTOR) drops 12.5% after reporting FQ3 revenue of $1.29B (+33% Y/Y) and adjusted EPS of $0.26, below a consensus of $1.31B and $0.29. Free cash flow (FCF) was -$1M. The company expects FQ4 revenue of $1.175B-$1.275B, compared with a consensus of $1.25B. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:20 PM
  • LQDT

    Liquidity Services (NASDAQ:LQDT), which runs an online auction site for surplus and salvage...

    Liquidity Services (NASDAQ:LQDT), which runs an online auction site for surplus and salvage assets, is up 14.2% after reporting FQ3 revenue of $86.1M (+18% Y/Y) and adjusted EPS of $0.26, beating a consensus of $82.3M and $0.20. The company expects FQ4 adjusted EPS of $0.18-$0.20, above the $0.17 consensus. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:08 PM
  • PH

    More on Parker Hannifin (PH -6.3%): shares are down after FQ4 EPS came up penny shy of...

    More on Parker Hannifin (PH -6.3%): shares are down after FQ4 EPS came up penny shy of expectations, despite a 32% increase in revenues. The company lowers its FY12 forecast, now saying earnings will be $6.70 to $7.50 per share, below the $7.51 previously expected.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:04 PM
  • DOLNQ

    Business information services firm The Dolan Company (NYSE:DM) gains 14.3% after reporting Q2...

    Business information services firm The Dolan Company (NYSE:DM) gains 14.3% after reporting Q2 revenue of $69.4M (-12% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.09, roughly in-line with consensus. The company expects 2011 revenue of $297-$305M, in-line with a $299.7M consensus. Dolan shares were down 44% YTD prior to today's move. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:57 PM
  • MLM

    Martin Marietta Materials (MLM -4.8%) trades lower after saying its Q2 earnings missed...

    Martin Marietta Materials (MLM -4.8%) trades lower after saying its Q2 earnings missed estimates. Profits dropped 34% as top-line margins were hit by significantly lower sales of aggregate products across virtually all its business lines due to erratic weather.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:39 PM
  • IIVI

    Precision components manufacturer II-VI (IIVI -11%) gets hit after its FQ4 fell short of...

    Precision components manufacturer II-VI (IIVI -11%) gets hit after its FQ4 fell short of estimates. Top-line revenues were hurt by weak demand in its near-infrared optics unit as inventory adjustments continue to negatively impact telecommunications markets.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:25 PM
  • CHK

    Shares of Chesapeake Energy (CHK +2.5%) gain steam after Johnson & Rice raises EPS estimates...

    Shares of Chesapeake Energy (CHK +2.5%) gain steam after Johnson & Rice raises EPS estimates for FY11 to $3.05/share, from $2.91/share. Yesterday, the firm announced a 17% dividend hike, marking its first payout increase since 2008.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:18 PM
  • EXPD

    Shares of Expeditors International (EXPD -7.6%) suffer after the firm misses analyst...

    Shares of Expeditors International (EXPD -7.6%) suffer after the firm misses analyst expectations for Q2 earnings and revenue. The firm reports stronger growth in its airfreight services for Q2, offset for a large part by lower revenue from ocean freight and services.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:06 PM
  • H

    Hyatt (H -1.8%) reverses sharp early gains made after a solid earnings report, as a weak hotel...

    Hyatt (H -1.8%) reverses sharp early gains made after a solid earnings report, as a weak hotel complex drags the shares down. HOT -5%, IHG -4.8%, MAR -2.6%, WYN -3.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:02 PM
  • SNCR

    Shares of Synchronoss Technologies (SNCR +22.9%) pop after riding a wave of good news including...

    Shares of Synchronoss Technologies (SNCR +22.9%) pop after riding a wave of good news including a strong Q2 earnings report and a lawsuit settlement with Dashwire over patent infringement. The stock sits a hair below its 52-week high. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:47 AM
  • AMFW

    More on Foster Wheeler (FWLT +7.6%): Q2 easily beat estimates, aided by a 79% surge in profit...

    More on Foster Wheeler (FWLT +7.6%): Q2 easily beat estimates, aided by a 79% surge in profit from the company's power business. Operating revenue from the engineering and construction segment, it's largest business, improved just 5.9% as the economy continues to sputter.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:43 AM
  • PPS

    Upscale apartment developer Post Properties (PPS +2.3%) Q2 swung to a profit as its funds from...

    Upscale apartment developer Post Properties (PPS +2.3%) Q2 swung to a profit as its funds from operations - a key measure of REIT profitability - went from a previous-year loss to a gain. Fundamentals improved, with occupancy rates and monthly rents both rising Y/Y. The company raises its FY11 FFO outlook by 13%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:13 AM

  • In free-fall again, shares in Italy's UniCredit are suspended -5% on the day. The lender - with...

    In free-fall again, shares in Italy's UniCredit are suspended -5% on the day. The lender - with nearly €1T in assets - has lost 26% of its value in the last 30 days as the EU debt contagion skips over Spain and moves right to Italy. Italian ETF: EWI -2%. European shares at their lows of the session: VGK -1.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM | 1 Comment
  • CVLT

    Storage software vendor CommVault (NASDAQ:CVLT) is up 10.5% after reporting FQ1 revenue and...

    Storage software vendor CommVault (NASDAQ:CVLT) is up 10.5% after reporting FQ1 revenue and non-GAAP EPS of $91.5M (+38% Y/Y) and $0.21, trouncing a consensus of $83.6M and $0.17. With software license revenue up 55% Y/Y, the company appears to be gaining share against rival Symantec (NASDAQ:SYMC) in high-end, enterprise accounts. (PR) (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM
  • OMX

    OfficeMax (OMX +14%) trades higher in relief after its Q2 beat, albeit on low expectations. The...

    OfficeMax (OMX +14%) trades higher in relief after its Q2 beat, albeit on low expectations. The reality is the company closed eight stores, and posted its 14th revenue decline over 15 quarters. Even with todays rally, the stock is still down over 40% for the year and badly underperforming the market.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:53 AM
  • JCP

    JC Penney (JCP +2.7%) shoots higher on rumors of an LBO. The stock needs a boost as it has given...

    JC Penney (JCP +2.7%) shoots higher on rumors of an LBO. The stock needs a boost as it has given back the entirety of its euphoric gains made in the wake of Apple's (NASDAQ:AAPL) Ron Johnson moving to the company.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:47 AM | 1 Comment
  • CTRP

    Chinese travel service provider Ctrip.com (NASDAQ:CTRP) is down 10.3%. Yesterday evening, the...

    Chinese travel service provider Ctrip.com (NASDAQ:CTRP) is down 10.3%. Yesterday evening, the company reported Q2 revenue and EPS of $137M (+20% Y/Y) and $0.35, beating a consensus of $129.6M and $0.27. However, Ctrip's Q3 annual revenue growth guidance of 15-20% is below a consensus of 24.9% growth. (PR) (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:38 AM
  • IT

    Shares of Gartner (IT +2.7%) move higher after the firms reports an adjusted EPS for Q2 of...

    Shares of Gartner (IT +2.7%) move higher after the firms reports an adjusted EPS for Q2 of $0.34/share vs. consensus $0.31/share on revenue of $250M (+20% Y/Y). The firm raises FY 11 revenue guidance slightly to $1.44B-$1.49B, from a prior range of  $1.43B-$1.48B.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM
  • DIN

    DineEquity (DIN -14%) DIN) second-quarter profit fell 98% as restaurant-closure costs and weak...

    DineEquity (DIN -14%) DIN) second-quarter profit fell 98% as restaurant-closure costs and weak performance at its IHOP chain hurt results, though core earnings held steady." target="_blank">Q2 profit drops 98% as EPS and revenue expectations missed across-the-board. Top-line margins were hurt as IHOP continues to record tepid sales, and high closure costs stemming from the re-franchising its Applebees chain weigh heavily on bottom-line margins.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:16 AM | 1 Comment
  • IPGP

    Industrial laser manufacturer IPG Photonics (NASDAQ:IPGP) is up 8.1% after reporting FQ3 revenue...

    Industrial laser manufacturer IPG Photonics (NASDAQ:IPGP) is up 8.1% after reporting FQ3 revenue and EPS of $121.9M (+81% Y/Y) and $0.63, beating a consensus of $108.3M and $0.55. The company expects FQ4 revenue of $120M-$130M and EPS of $0.56-$0.68, compared with a consensus of $114.8M and $0.58. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:05 AM
  • TMUS

    Shares of MetroPCS (PCS -28.8%) freefall after its $0.06 earnings miss. The firm's churn rate...

    Shares of MetroPCS (PCS -28.8%) freefall after its $0.06 earnings miss. The firm's churn rate jumped 18% Y/Y in Q2, and could jump higher in Q3 according to comments made this morning in a CC.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:03 AM
  • AMED

    Amedisys (AMED -14%) Q2 misses estimates as profits fell 33% on a drop in net service revenue....

    Amedisys (AMED -14%) Q2 misses estimates as profits fell 33% on a drop in net service revenue. Earnings have suffered the past few quarters after the federal government began scrutinizing the company over a possible abuse of Medicare rules. The company also lowered its FY1 forecast, which excludes the impact of Friday's Medicaid decision.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:51 AM
  • QRVO

    Shares of Triquent Semiconductor (TQNT +2.9%) move higher after Kaufman sets a $9 price target...

    Shares of Triquent Semiconductor (TQNT +2.9%) move higher after Kaufman sets a $9 price target and a Buy rating. The firm sees bottom-line improvement after the new iPhone launches this fall. Shares still sit over 50% off their 52-week high.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:49 AM
  • H

    Hyatt Hotels (H +6.3%) Q2 beats on a 48% jump in profits as higher revenue per-room improved...

    Hyatt Hotels (H +6.3%) Q2 beats on a 48% jump in profits as higher revenue per-room improved margins. The company has seen a solid improvement in its bottom line over the past few quarters, as a recovery in demand among business travelers has translated into higher occupancy and room rates.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:33 AM
  • INSM

    Insmed (NASDAQ:INSM) is down 40.5% premarket after announcing the FDA has placed a clinical hold...

    Insmed (NASDAQ:INSM) is down 40.5% premarket after announcing the FDA has placed a clinical hold on the company's phase 3 clinical trials for its Arikace drug for treating lung illnesses. The FDA has requested additional information on Arikace, which Insmed expects to provide in the next 30 days.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:28 AM
  • ANTM

    Amerigroup (AGP) rebounds after winning an expanded Medicaid contract extension in Texas, its...

    Amerigroup (AGP) rebounds after winning an expanded Medicaid contract extension in Texas, its largest market. Stifel Nicolaus upgrades shares to Buy, saying investors “are rethinking their views of the Medicaid MCOs in the wake of AGP’s disappointing 2Q results... the earnings miss drove an overreaction in the shares relative to pending growth.” AGP +5.1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:26 AM
  • RDN

    Radian Group (NYSE:RDN) Q2 swings to a profit, benefitting from large derivatives gains and a...

    Radian Group (NYSE:RDN) Q2 swings to a profit, benefitting from large derivatives gains and a smaller provision for mortgage insurance losses due to a decline in delinquencies. The stock is rebounding this morning after taking a hit last month when MGIC (NYSE:MTG) posted a Q2 loss on a surge in claims losses. Shares +13.3% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:18 AM
  • RDN

    Premarket gainers: RDN +12%. SM +9%. AGP +6%. ARNA +4%. PMI +4%. SIRI +4%. HCA +3%. BCS...

    Premarket gainers: RDN +12%. SM +9%. AGP +6%. ARNA +4%. PMI +4%. SIRI +4%. HCA +3%. BCS +3%.
    Losers: INSM -42%. PCS -17%. NVMI -7%. KLIC -6%. ADM -4%. FRO -4%. LYG -3%. CS -4%. MT -3%. ARIA -3%. UBS -3%. ALV -3%. RIO -3%. ITUB -3%. NOK -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM
  • TMUS

    More on MetroPCS (PCS): Q2 earnings missed the mark as margins declined on higher costs and a...

    More on MetroPCS (PCS): Q2 earnings missed the mark as margins declined on higher costs and a sharp slowdown in subscriber growth. New customer growth was the lowest in nearly 2 years as the pre-paid wireless provider tries to remain relevant in a market dominated by Verizon Wireless (VZ, VOD)and AT&T (NYSE:T). Shares -16.5% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:55 AM
  • MT

    Shares of ArcelorMittal (NYSE:MT) and Peabody Energy (NYSE:BTU) trade lower after their $5.2B...

    Shares of ArcelorMittal (NYSE:MT) and Peabody Energy (NYSE:BTU) trade lower after their $5.2B takeover bid for MacArthur Coal (OTC:MACDY) falls flat. The board of the Australian coal producer is working to secure a better deal than the $15.50/share all-cash "non-hostile" offer, and is not yet prepared to counter at $16/share. Shares of MT -3.2% BTU -1.6% down premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:50 AM
  • KLIC

    Kulicke & Soffa (NASDAQ:KLIC) posts a solid FQ3, easily beating estimates. Revenue was +44%...

    Kulicke & Soffa (NASDAQ:KLIC) posts a solid FQ3, easily beating estimates. Revenue was +44% Y/Y, with strong demand from its Ball and Wedge bonder equipment lines.  However, the company reduces guidance for FQ4, citing weak demand. It now expects revenue of around $155M, below expectations of $211M. Shares -2.8% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:32 AM
  • MOH

    Molina Healthcare (NYSE:MOH) announces a wholly owned subsidiary of the firm has been awarded...

    Molina Healthcare (NYSE:MOH) announces a wholly owned subsidiary of the firm has been awarded Medicaid managed care contracts from the Texas Health and Human Services Commission. Shares +6.5% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:28 AM
  • CGNX

    Cognex (NASDAQ:CGNX), a maker of industrial machine vision systems, is up 5.4% premarket after...

    Cognex (NASDAQ:CGNX), a maker of industrial machine vision systems, is up 5.4% premarket after reporting revenue and EPS of $83.4M (+16% Y/Y) and $0.45, beating a consensus of $80.7M and $0.37. The company expects Q3 revenue of $78M-$81M, compared with a consensus of $78.3M. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:20 AM
  • SM

    SM Energy (NYSE:SM) reports Q2 revenue of $378M (+78% Y/Y) and beats analyst estimates with...

    SM Energy (NYSE:SM) reports Q2 revenue of $378M (+78% Y/Y) and beats analyst estimates with $0.91 EPS vs. consensus $0.55. Bank of America sets a Buy rating with a $83 price target based on lower production costs and higher realized commodity prices. Shares +11.2% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:20 AM
  • ADM

    More on Archer Daniels Midland's (NYSE:ADM) EPS miss: Company says tax more than tripled to...

    More on Archer Daniels Midland's (NYSE:ADM) EPS miss: Company says tax more than tripled to $385M due to "unfavorable" one-time items and changes in the firm's geographic mix of earnings. For FY12 expects effective tax rate to be in range of 28%-30%, down from 50% effective tax rate in Q4. Shares -4.6% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:06 AM
  • PFE

    More on Pfizer's (NYSE:PFE) Q2: U.S. revenue -9% Y/Y, international revenue +5% Y/Y. Growth in...
